Subject: Re: [sfraves] JEWS RUN THIS COUNTRY AND THE WAR.....BUSH is merely a PUPPET. ...

Ok first of all this stream sent here isn't nessesarily "Nazi-ish" at all 
because it's not saying anything about genecide. It may very well be 
propaganda i would say. but if this person, who ever sent this really thinks 
this is what's actually going on, wouldn't you rather know than not know? 
it's just one more perhaps rediculous posibility for intent of wanting this 
war. decide for yourself. i wouldn't be any more suprized to see some 
anti-christian propaganda or anti-islam this one just happens to be directed 
towards claiming that the U.S. is run by jews & that jews are war mongerers. 
that's probably not true at all! but on the other hand they are not saying 
"so & so are better than jews" or saying "get rid of jewish people".    - 
that's my opinion & i didn't mind reading this wierd stuff, & i know i 
wouldn't ever look this kind of stuff up out of my own curiousity. so it 
served as some kind of purpose being sent to me organized and easy to find.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: A Concert of the Arts - sat april 12

// Saturday April 12
Second Saturday ArtWalk Festivities


Liquidcafe.com proudly presents...

Merge 3-year anniversary production

                   A CONCERT OF THE ARTS
                    Midtown, Sacramento

                 Special musical guests:

         BOX JAZZ TRIO [ live jazz performance ]

Box Jazz Trio is:
MAX HART, piano (Los Angeles)
Studied jazz piano and organ with Larry Goldings. Band leader for LA
rock group “Highspeed Scene”. Keyboardist for solo artist “Kenna”.

GEORGE BAN-WEISS, bass (Berkeley)
Engineering major at UC Berkeley. Jazz tutelage by resident pianist/jazz 
educator Bevan, jazz dept. UC Berekeley.

JAMES NEIL, drums (Sacramento)
Studied jazz with Dr. Joe Gilman, American River College; Monterrey Jazz 
Festival representative; performances in Europe, Australia, and New Zealand. 
Guest performance @ Capitol Jazz Project


“It’s fair to say that all the musicians in our trio are versatile; jazz is 
what we come together to play. The trio setting allows us all a lot of space 
creatively to stretch things out. Soloists stretch out
individually during improvisation. Because of our collective experience
we are able to go “out” together. Almost everything can be stretched and 
shaped when we play: harmony and melody, rhythm, song form.”
                                          -- James Neil

Standards/Interpreted Material/Influences:
Miles Davis, John Coltrane, McCoy Tyner, Bill Evans, Brad Mehldau, and
Larry Goldings


Also featuring:

MICHAEL YAGER, comedian, actor
[ A unique comedic performance with selections from his one-man show,
“Man of the House.” Accompanied by Vinyl Artist Paul Gordon spinning
slick jazz, gospel, pop, and rock tunes ]

    -- Funky Symphony & Feel-good Vibes --
         provided by Vinyl artists:

     [ Jazzy house ]
     Kiyoshi 1 (Scientists of Sound, Santa Cruz)
     D’John (WUE, Sac)
     The Emperor’s Jazz (liquidcafe.com, Sac)

     [ Soulful & Ambient Drum n Bass ]
     Adria (Liquidcafe.com, Sac)
     Rouge (Momo Lounge/Plush, Stockton)


Works of Art:

// COALITION OF AFRO AMERICAN ARTISTS (Ronn Turner, Curator)
   Traveling exhibit of afro american works.
// STERLING GALLERY [ Pieces from the gallery ]
// SHAUN TURNER & KEVIN PRICE [ Abstract ]
// AMY ZEHNER [ Photographic Artist ]

Two Rooms of Aural and Visual stimuli.
Stylish, hip venue.

Sound:  Summit Sessions


Showtime: 9pm
18 and over
Full bar 21+ w/ID

Infoline: 916.466.9113  / 415.303.7404

Admission: No more than 8 bucks! (price roll-back!)
Unheard of in this day of 60 dollar ticket prices!!
*sorry no comp passes*


It is important that Price Point be attractive, so everyone can afford
it. This is about bringing a quality event to our community.
We just want you all to be able to come and enjoy the show.

NOTE: This event is in conjunction with Sacramento's monthly Second
Saturday Art-Walk festivities in galleries around the midtown area. Plan 
your evening's logistics for maximum pleasure!


Liquidcafe.com
"Devoted to bringing the highest quality entertainment to Sacramento and 
surrounding communities."

Hmmm, I would disagree.  I also skipped through this guys links to see where it was coming from and found that it is disturbingly racist enough.  
After seeing the link to the article about the supposed systematic attack on america's whites called "The Browning of America" there is no doubt that this person is a nazi-style skinhead type and I'm suprised he didn't have a link to some page that argued against evidence of the Halocaust.  
Like the great majority of sensible folks on this list, I'm offended by this racist crap and suprised to see it in our forum.  However, I was also pissed off and offended to discover another racist website while following another seemling harmless post made recently.  
Clicking on this joke-story about the "Time Traveler" ( ATP: Fact of Fiction? ), I followed the link to the WWN Web guide to this mock CNN site: http://www.cnniraq.com .  I feel weird even posting the link but I'll warn you that it took me about 5 seconds clicking on one banner ad about what will happen if Iraq uses WMDs, to see a nuke mushroom cloud with the caption "Take that Camel Jockeys!"  
My next move is to email the webmaster@weeklyworldnews.com and editor@weeklyworldnews.com to let them know they're linking to an offensively racist website.  
 JBlaze112@aol.com wrote:Ok first of all this stream sent here isn't nessesarily "Nazi-ish" at all 
because it's not saying anything about genecide. It may very well be 
propaganda i would say. but if this person, who ever sent this really thinks 
this is what's actually going on, wouldn't you rather know than not know? 
it's just one more perhaps rediculous posibility for intent of wanting this 
war. decide for yourself. i wouldn't be any more suprized to see some 
anti-christian propaganda or anti-islam this one just happens to be directed 
towards claiming that the U.S. is run by jews & that jews are war mongerers. 
that's probably not true at all! but on the other hand they are not saying 
"so & so are better than jews" or saying "get rid of jewish people". - 
that's my opinion & i didn't mind reading this wierd stuff, & i know i 
wouldn't ever look this kind of stuff up out of my own curiousity. so it 
served as some kind of purpose being sent to me organized and easy to find.

Subject: [sfraves] jumping on that rave bandwagon nrr

--0-1852362646-1049237319=:64044
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

i was just reflecting on my experience of the scene for the last going on six years, and in a nutshell, i had approxiately one smidgen of pure pleasure that i have been chasing ever since, and the rest has been watching people do stuff that they think might make them like totally cool, but actually serves no purpose at all accept for the fact that they are being more annoying than usual. i have jumped continually back and away from as much as possible, and had to see things get really extra gross. i have at times believed that i have been understood, and actually what has happened is that people think the parts i couldn't stand were like my totally favorite parts and then added them to their permanent repretoire, and have tried to incorporate more shit into my life than i could possible dump down what is now a clogged sewage mine of emptiness, glutony and thoughtless, impulsive living. you know, it's like, okay, maybe if you hide for a few days and come back, i might wear my tiniest underwear to your party and be your friend in exactly the way you want me to be. gross. you know, some people were concerned that things would get worse, but also, i think they make things worse on their own. :)

gypsies.  As a PC member of society, I suggest you drop that word from your
vocabulary. Or don't, I don't care.  I'm just breeding awareness.

You wouldn't say (or maybe you would) that someone jewed you out of money,
so don't say they gypped you.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] getting jipped nrr

>Are Gypsies still around?
>
>What exactly *is* a gypsy?
>
>Where are the "gypsies" today?
>
>And "gypsy" is a race? My closest mental definition would be simply
>someone who camps with a small community that moves around a lot.

They are definitely still around, mostly in eastern europe. I think that
Gypsies originally came out of Romania or Bulgaria, and spread out across
Europe in mobile communities. Because they generally don't put down too
many roots, they are perceived as freeloaders or undesirables by a lot of
europeans, and often make up the bulk of the homeless population. This has
been my experience in Poland, anyway.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] getting jipped nrr

:: 
:: Are Gypsies still around?

to my understanding, yes.

:: 
:: What exactly *is* a gypsy?

a gypsy is a person of Roma descent. Not all gypsies are nomadic.
more info here:
http://www.geocities.com/Paris/5121/vlib/introduction.htm

:: 
:: Where are the "gypsies" today?

by nature gypsies are Romani and live in Romania and eastern Europe. though
they originated from the indian continent. apparently moving to europe due
to some sort of persecution [i don't know the specifics].

:: 
:: And "gypsy" is a race?

yes.

:: My closest mental definition would be simply someone who 
:: camps with a small community that moves around a lot.
:: 

i used to think the same thing until i worked with a romanian who immigated
to the states and worked at a job with me. i found it interesting as he
himself placed a bit more distinction on the term "gypsy" as not all
Romanians are gypsies. it's basically a racial subsection.

i of course welcome any other's information as i'm not Romani myself.

anyways, i've got more work to do. hope this helps shed some light on your
questions.

m.

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

There are gypsies in Spain. They (at least the ones that I have 
seen/met) usually live in small villages in the hills that feature no 
runnign water/sewage, tiny shacks, and children running around with no 
clothes on. They usually make their living off fortune telling, crafts, 
and selling random things at town fairs & vacation spots. And aparantly, 
my family's ranch house in Spain got looted by gypsies.. but I have no 
way of confirming that.

That's all I know.

-jv

in the old testament the children of god used to fight fiercely for what they 
believed in but in the new testament three new ideas were introduced  
the first is that you get salvation through grace & not through works 
meaning you get it through your influence & your example rather than your 
deeds 
the second idea is that there are no divisions of classes in the eyes of god 
the third idea of the new testamate is that when one is wronged 
you turn the other cheek 
you love your enimy so to speak 
but what the United States is doing now 
is saying we agree with the first two ideas but we are ignoring the third 
idea 
and we believe there is such a thing as a "just" war 
so what's two of out of three? 
percentage wise? 
.666%
two out of three ain't bad right...? 
ok so maybe the percentage thing is a wierd idea but
i'm saying it makes sense this whole war thing... there is just cause 
but there's isn't just cause enough for biblical backing 
bush can't say god's name when he's talking about the war 
that would be hypocritical 
BUT HE DOES
it's only a war in god's name if you only consider the first testament 
in the new testament "god" comes to us and dies for our sins and shows us the 
true meaning of love
everything after that would make all violence unjust 
so in that respect our position in the war is essentially jewish 
so ironic 
because bush is considered to be a christian 
and he probably won the election with a huge amount christian votes

p.s. i'm no fanatic, i think the war would be more acceptable if we left god 
out of it compleately & said we are doing this for political reasons only. 
but that's not what bush says in his speaches and so that's how our position 
is either hypocritical or we are associating god in the sense that jewish 
people do, as one of wrath & justice. So you have a huge theological debate 
underhand here & i believe certain people do have a right to be outraged by 
our position in this war.

There were around 2 million gypsies killed by the Nazis during WWII. It is
still socially acceptable in most of Europe to basically think of them as
less than human, because of their lifestyle doesn't integrate well with
European society and because many are involved in petty criminal activity
(that's what most Europeans will tell you anyway).

SFRaves<-_->http: //www.sfraves.org

X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Update: Ass crack

http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n420/a08.html?111

- R.A.V.E. Reincarnated

You must wonder how a bill to rewrite statutes with almost a three decade
history dedicated solely a specific law and subject matter has now been
proposed to be broadened in scope to include all other vague descriptions
of activities once only pertained to crack, not the one in your ass or in
the sidewalk.

Source:
URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n395/a05.html
Newshawk: JimmyG
Pubdate: Thu, 13 Mar 2003
Source: Austin Chronicle (TX)
Copyright: 2003 Austin Chronicle Corp.
Contact: louis@auschron.com
Website: http://www.auschron.com/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/33
Author: Jordan Smith
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/raves.htm (Raves)
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/mdma.htm (Ecstasy)


"It's baaaack.

The proposed, and extremely draconian, Reducing Americans' Vulnerability
to Ecstasy ( RAVE ) Act has reemerged this Congressional session --
although it no longer bears that catchy little moniker.

The bill was filed last session by Sen.  Joe Biden, D-Del., and proposed
extending the nets of the infamous Biden-sponsored Eighties "crack house
laws" by broadening their definition to include any businessperson, club
owner, or promoter on whose property or at whose events illicit drugs are
used or sold.  The legislation was clearly aimed at squashing the rave
scene, but drug reformers and civil libertarians quickly cried foul at the
law's broad language, which could apply to any use of property, no matter
how "temporary," potentially including citizens who use drugs in their own
homes.  Representatives from the ACLU, Students for Sensible Drug Policy,
and other reformers took their ire to Capitol Hill last fall when they
staged a rave dance-rally in the halls of Congress.  Shortly thereafter,
the bill began to hemorrhage sponsors and then quietly disappeared.

That is, until this month, when it cropped up again attached to an omnibus
domestic-security bill -- the Justice Enhancement and Domestic Security
Act of 2003, sponsored by Tom Daschle, D-S.D.  -- in a section on
"Crack-House Statute Amendments." The ploy -- attaching a controversial
provision to a fuzzy-bunny bill that no one is likely to vote against --
is common.

Indeed, the revamped RAVE Act has been dumped into legislation whose other
provisions would help protect missing and exploited children, senior
citizens, and rape victims, and would combat telemarketing fraud and
identity theft.

But RAVE wasn't hidden well enough to evade the eyes of drug reformers,
who are planning once again to protest.

For more info, check out the Drug Policy Alliance Web site at www.dpa.org.
..."

Informed Awareness et La paix,
Karina

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

US CA: Cop Group Targets 'Rave' Drugs
URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n376/a04.html
Newshawk: Tips for writing LTEs http://www.mapinc.org/resource/tips.htm
Pubdate: Wed, 05 Mar 2003
Source: San Francisco Examiner (CA)
Copyright: 2003 San Francisco Examiner
Contact: letters@sfexaminer.com
Website: http://www.examiner.com/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/389
Author: William W. Chiang, Special to The Examiner
Note: Kathy Schrenk contributed to this article.
Cited: California Narcotics Officers' Association http://www.cnoa.org/
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/raves.htm (Raves)

"COP GROUP TARGETS 'RAVE' DRUGS

REDWOOD CITY -- As a direct response to the giant New Year's Eve party at
Daly City's Cow Palace, where drugs were suspected in the deaths of two
men, the California Narcotics Officers' Association is encouraging cities
and counties to tighten permit processes and oversight of raves.

The group has announced a list of guidelines meant to help local agencies
curtail or eliminate the presence of "illegal and deadly drugs" at such
events.

The six-point strategy is designed to keep rave organizers from claiming
ignorance of drug paraphernalia and the presence of drugs at their events,
said Rick Oules, the association's president.

"I want to stress very much that this has nothing to do with dance, music
or free expression," he said.  "This has everything to do with drugs, drug
dealing and young people dying."

Traditionally, a rave was an all-night, underground event, said John
Lovell, the CNOA's legislative counsel.  Raves are marked by loud dance
music and often by the presence of illegal drugs.

Mood-altering ecstasy is one of the most common rave drugs, according to
Dave Tresmontan, assistant chief for the California Bureau of Narcotics
Enforcement.

Long-term ecstasy use can cause severe depression, anxiety, insomnia or
even organ failure.

"Raves have become big business," Lovell said.

"We would encourage the use of existing authority to put a permit process
in place to get more of a handle on the events themselves."

Based in Southern California, the CNOA represents some 7,500 local, state
and federal officers mainly focused on drug enforcement.

The concern is the drugs, Lovell said, adding that the association's
"working definition" of a rave is, "an electronic music event attended by
at least 500 persons ...  commonly referred to as rave parties."

In addition to suggesting a 1 a.m.  curfew, the six points primarily
revolve around the conditions event promoters must meet before gaining a
permit.

As put forth in the points, a promoter must prove it is "sufficiently
knowledgeable about illegal drugs and drug paraphernalia and can recognize
their presence at a rave event."

Another suggests that promoters must sign a document promising they will
not "permit, condone, or ignore local laws regarding the presence,
possession, sale, or use of illegal drugs and drug paraphernalia at their
event."

Existing San Mateo County law regulating "public dances" on county
property already contains a series of requirements before a permit is
granted.

In addition to submitting event time, date and location, promoters must
provide fingerprints of anyone involved in operating the dance.

Those under the influence of "intoxicating liquor or narcotics" are
prohibited.

The regulations even stipulate the size and location of the dance floor,
and that the dance's premises must be "well lighted." The sheriff and
county fire and health officials also must approve the permit.

As of press time, Coolworld, which promoted the annual Planet New Year
event, did not respond to The Independent's repeated requests for comment
on the CNOA's initiative.

As with most Cow Palace events, a private security company contracted with
the arena provided security at the Dec.  31 Coolworld celebration, with
some 15 Daly City police officers patrolling the exterior.

Regarding the association's six points, Michael Wegher, CEO of the Cow
Palace, would only say, "Anything law enforcement does to crack down on
drug use is a plus.  Everybody should do the best they can."

MODELS NEEDED FOR FASHION SHOW

for 4 years. We have thrived to bring in the best and new innovations
to the business.

 We are looking for some up coming models to do our fashion show.
Experience is not a must but an added bonus. This gives the model an
added extra experience. The show will only be a 20 minute show, and
would require 2 practices. If interested please contact me at (415)
310-1488, or thru email madi@plushfridays.com

 What we are looking for: Plush has catered to a very mix crowd. What
we want is a fresh new face, someone who is outgoing, and very relaxed
to a crowd. What I need is 2 Asian models male and female, 2
Latin/Spanish models male and female, 2 white models male and female,
and 2 African models, male and female.

    sales. Essentially, each model will receive 50 pre-sale tickets at

Subject: [sfraves] David Harness@ Runway Fashion Shows Ap.25

David Harness and Love Slap records mates, Jay-J/Yshara, and Charles
Spencer. Will beat the turntables into submission at

2003 Runway Fashion Shows
Mezzanine
440 jessie
ap.25, 2003
((Anton Styles will DJ in the VIP room))


The Mezzanine San Francisco's newest and finest dance club sprouts up 1/2
block from SF's Nordstrom's. Across the street are the old San Francisco
Mint, and the Chronicle "Newspaper".
The Mezzanine is run by the world Famous crew from the Club Townsend.  Sure
to be the best sounding club. This is the maiden club sound install of
"Ultra Magnetics". Run by Jeno and the Wicked crews black Sheep brother,  (I
forgot his name).  He is responsible for making JK sound "The Rave sound
system" supplier for the north coast and beyond.
Ultra Magnetics will be the preeminent club install company.

But for now, you can  listen to excellent DJ's on an excellent sound system.

Oh, by the way. Interrupting the music, there will also be the finest
fashion show to kick off the night.  Brynne Cortez is credited with starting
the current "fashion show trend" with her mythic "Space Cowgirls" fashion
shows.
Anton Styles will reinvent runway music, providing a full spectrum of music,
inspired by the fashion designers. Afterwards, Anton will settle back into
music of his own choosing up in the VIP rooms.



In 1990, David began DJ'ing in his hometown of Monterey, California,
at the After Dark. As his popularity grew past the boundaries of Monterey,
he was invited to establish a residency at Tilt, and Sound Factory, in San
Francisco. In 1992, as David's popularity continued to grow he, along with
DJ, Ruben Mancias and promoter Joseph Solis opened a hip and popular club,
Lift, at Club Dv8. David joined Bay Area legendary DJ, Pete Avila and host
Foxxee Brown on 'Your Mama's House', on the Bay Area's popular radio station
KMEL FM. Being the only "true" house mix show on any Northern California
radio station, DJ's David Harness, Pete Avila and host Foxxee Brown have
played a key role in furthering House Music in the Bay Area. Also during
that year, David established a residency at San Francisco's legendary Club
Universe. David Harness has quickly become one of the most well known and
popular DJ's in the San Francisco Bay Area club scene. David's popularity
continued to soar, taking him around the world; and the opportunity to play
with New York's Legendary DJ's, Frankie Knuckles, Tony Humphries, Little
Louie Vega, Tedd Patterson, Dave Morales, London's Ricky Morrison, Danny
Teneglia, Marques Wyatt- to name a few. He has appeared in articles and
interviews in Billboard Magazine, Paper Magazine, Surface, XLR8R, Urb,
Streetsounds, Sweater, HX, Next and the Bay Guardian.           [PARA]

The point is
Just because you read it on the web does not make it true.
Matt, check your sources of information. Some of those human shields are on
this list.


World Net daily, (The website you posted the urls from) is a Christian right
pro-gun anti-drug e-magazine. You can get a gist of the editorial bias of a
news site by searching for hot topics.
I must say that most of the articles were really well written. And the
articles I posted were interesting in and of themselves, in that they
finished by saying that Christians should not support the drug war.

Correct me if Im wrong, but that quote just gets longer and longer everytime 
I see it.

Before the war I heard chris rock say this:

"You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy,
and the best golfer is a black guy"

Then after the war, I heard this:

"You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy,
the best golfer is a black guy, France is accusing the US of arrogance,
and Germany doesn't want to go to war."

Its all fallen apart...some troll put these quotes together and they dont 
even sound good.

anyway...my apologies if this is a real quote, but thats my 
understanding..how annoying.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Commander Tom - Trip to Noom - May 10

Saturday May 10, 2003

Modified and norcalraves.org presents...

Trip to Noom

Featuring:
COMMANDER TOM
Stuttgart, Germany
(Noom Records, Ultimate, Bush)
Commander Tom has been DJing and creating music for the last 17 years.
He  runs 7 labels, roughly 20 music projects and has played at almost
every major event in the world, including Energy 92-96, Tribal
Gathering, Omni 93, Rave City 3&4, Union Move, Time Tunnel and each of
the Love Parades.

In addition to being the label leader of the successful German Noom
imprint  (which has branched out to New York and London as well),
Commander Tom is  also in charge of Deluxe Germany, Deluxe UK, Monkey
Business, 12 inch  Monkeys and Phan-Tom.  On top of that, he owns the
revered Deluxe Sound Lab  studios 1 and 2.

Tom has worked for various labels under countless guises, including
Commander Tom, Tom Deluxe, Koenig Deluxe, Mandala, Nexus 6, The
Freaquez,  Andy Trex, Chef New Yorker, Phan-Tom, Waterhouse, Toronto and
many more.  His massive list of remixes includes more than a hundred
reworks for talent  such as Sourmash, Baby Doc, Chris Liberator, Eric
Powell, The Acen, U96,  Acrid Abayence, Tesox, DJ Sammy, RMB and Jon The
Dentist.

DYLOOT
San Francisco
(Skills, Dancing Spirit Recordings)

ENEMY

San Francisco
(Elektrosorcery) 

WAVELENGTH

-----Original Message-----
From: shawn allen [mailto:shawn@alterior.net]
Sent: Monday, March 31, 2003 12:20 PM
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: [sfraves] post-modern designation


quoth Ed Colmar:
> It seems that no matter how hard one searches or invents a title,
> someone else has thought of it, is currently doing it, or will do it
> in the future.

Too true. I had no idea how many DJ's named Shawn there were in the bay
area until I started attempting to promote myself on a wider scale (even
scarier: check out <http://shawnallen.com/>).

Coming up with titles that are easy to say, write, and remember is
difficult. And if you do decide to change it, how do you let everyone
know? I've been just going by my real name for years now, and I just
recently decided that it's time to invent an alias. But should I somehow
incorporate it into my real name so that people recognize it? Or does my
obscurity help in that respect?

Just consider yourself lucky that you have a relatively cool name. Mine
is not one that lends itself well to performance.

> Going on new performance alias number five, I have come up with a new
> way to ensure that noone will ever be able to steal or coopt my
> performance name ever again.
> 
> The strategy goes against all marketing rules, and tends to alienate
> anyone that had any shred of identifying with it....  Perfect.
> 
> So, you will no longer see me performing as 'esc', as it is now a
> monthly event.  Congradualtions on the choice of a good name btw...
> 
> Now, I will be encrypting my perfromance name, so that it appears as a
> seemingly random string of numbers and letters, and changes on every
> flyer and release.

That's pretty fuckin' funny, but seriously... Why not just make up
something totally bizarre and stick with it? My girlfriend wanted to
register a domain a while back, and I told her not to be surprised if it
had been squatted. Needless to say, "Shazbot McDoodle Pants" is not a
very common phrase.

Hey, keeping with the obscure reference, how about just "DJ Shazbot"?
("Shazbot!" was Orkan word for "damn!" in the popular sitcom Mork &
Mindy) -- or is that too close to "ShezTek"? ;)

-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://415.577.3961
  http://alterior.net
  aim://shawnpallen

Subject: [sfraves] *TSUNAMI! Friday, April 18th! $5 Presales NOW AVAILABLE! :)  .bsp.

LiquidVinylDjs.com & Presto Parties are teaming up to bring you an event to 
rock ya right! After a long hiatus and a much needed break, we're back to 
bring you..

TSUNAMI!
Friday, April 18th 2003!
11pm-6am
$5 Presales
ALL AGES!

7 hours of outdoor madness! Join us as we celebrate the change from the cool 
winter months into the warm months of Spring and Summer! DJ's helping to 
bring you that vibe:


AREA ONE: TIDAL

CLOUDSKIPPER (LiquidVinylDjs.com/SonicFury.net: SPECIAL WELCOME BACK SET!)
We're very proud to welcome Cloudskipper, Hardcore extraordinaire, back to 
the Bay! After his move to Kentucky, he just couldn't stay away for long, 
and now he's back where he belongs! Fresh off his tour of the UK and working 
with several prominent producers and labels, he'll be dropping all the fresh 
dubplates and upfront material you've come to expect from him! Madness 
prevails here, no boundries!

DJ TRONIC (Resistance Recordings/LiquidVinylDjs.com)
In one of his last appearances before he starts his much anticipated tour in 
Spain, Tronic is coming out to drop only the Hardest material you've come to 
know! Expect the unexpected here, with a set ranging from Hard House to 
Hardcore to anything in between, this will be the one set to keep you on 
your toes and bangin' your head!

VALERIE SPARKS (ValerieSparks.com/Resistance Recordings)
With smooth mixing, energetic stage presence, and a smile to melt even the 
strongest, it's no wonder why Valerie is one of the most in-demand DJs on 
the West Coast. She'll be coming out to bring you the Hardcore like only she 
can.. so get your ass up, get movin!

ANTHONY MAD vs. KID COSMO (Mad Beats vs. Presto Parties)
The mad man meets the kid like whoa! In what's becoming one of the most 
requested pairings in all of Bay Area Hardcore, Anthony Mad and Kid Cosmo 
are coming to out to drop all the favorites you've come to known and love!

NO LEFT TURN vs. DJ REESE (LiquidVinylDjs.com - Nice Guys Finish Last 
Special Set!)
Proving that even if Nice Guys Finish Last, good skill will take you places! 
These two are coming out to rock just a bit harder, a bit faster, and a bit 
stronger!

PETER GO-ZANIA vs. LEON COOK (HCFTP vs. Neuroscience Creations)
What to expect from these two? Well quite frankly, we have no idea. What we 
do know for sure is that it's going to be fast. It's going to be hard. And, 
it's going to be in your face. Don't say we didn't warn you.

DJ VIRTUE vs. DJ BEEZ (ROT vs. Preserve)
Rounding out the night we have the pairing to take you over the top! The 
only limit here: NOTHING UNDER 200BPM. That's right, with Gabber becoming 
more and more popular here in the Bay, it's no wonder why these guys will be 
dropping 200+BPM bombs!


AREA TWO: WAVE.

JOEY MAZZOLA (Solmatic Records/JoeyMazzola.com)
Gaining wide acclaim for his work on the Solmatic label, Joey is quickly 
becoming one of the most sought after House DJ's in all of America! With his 
precise mixing, awesome scratching, and his overall nice guy status, it's no 
wonder to anyone why Joey is enjoying his continued success.

BAZOOKA JOE vs. RECKLESS RYAN (DJBazookaJoe.com vs. KSJS 90.5/Zero Magazine)
Two of the most talented DJs in the Bay collide for what promises to be one 
helluva set! From that funky ass shakin' house to that hard hittin' 
hardstyle, this set comes complete with scratching for days! Get your 
dancing shoes ready, this is the one to get wild to!

MICHAEL LIU vs. NEUROPSYNTIST (Illumination Records vs. Neuroscience 
Creations/Secret Psychadelica)
In need of some Psy in your life? Well, we've got the cure: Michael Liu & 
Neuropsyntist, two of the most underrated and underappreciated DJs here in 
the Bay. These two are responsible for the largely popular Neu Light events, 
as well as the always packed Secret Psychadelica nights! Sure to twist your 
mind in all new ways!

J-MARR vs. CARLOS ALFONZO (LiquidVinylDjs.com/Bayraves vs. 
Bayraves/Resistance Recordings)
The Ghetto Rice Maker meets The Carne Asada Chef in this showdown of food 
technicians! In all seriousness, these two are some of the nicest DJs you'll 
ever meet, and they're comin' out to prove that what they have in kindness, 
they double in skill!

PAUL THE FANMAN vs. DJ FOXX (Audio Metamorphosis/Kidz At Play vs. House on 
the Hill/Remix)
Ready for your beats a bit harder and energetic? These two will have you 
stompin the whole time as they lay down their signature sounds in a rare 
appearance together on the decks! Expect some serious crowd rockin!

THE DOCTOR VS. DJ DOUBLE DAY (Bayraves/Deciblast vs. Swatchdog Recordings)
With the growing popularity of Drum and Bass at all ages events, these two 
are looking to lead the pack of DJs eager to drop beats! If you like your 
Drum and Bass energetic, hard, and fun, this will be the set for you!

J-BIRD vs. ATHENA (Gravity Crew Madness Set)
Two of Tahoe's best, from one of the best and respected promotional outfits 
in the whole Tahoe area-the Gravity Crew! Expect nothing short of everything 
with this set, from breaks to house to hardstyle to NRG, it's gonna be 
covered, and covered right!

__________________________________________________________________________________

Help join us as we are kickin off Spring and Summer right... underneath the 
stars!
Centrally Located in the Immediate Bay Area!

*Hot Chocolate Being Served ALL NIGHT By: The Doctor & Carlos Alfonzo

[Earth Poundin' Sound Provided By: NEUROSCIENCE CREATIONS]

spot to party!

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Universal Groove - South Bay this Saturday

There's been a little controversy about the name of this group ("Universal
Groove") since I guess there was another well-respected group of the same
name a while back, before I fell into this rave bidness.  But name
problems aside, this party has potential and should be a buncha fun. 
It'll be running through a few 4:4 genres... trance, NRG, house, even a
bit of hardcore.  No techno, breaks, or jungle this time, but I hear if
this party does well it's intended to become a regular thing, and a new
outlet for our area's massive and diverse ocean of DJs.

Hope to see some of you there.  =)

Carter the Infamous Trance Lover

>>>>><<<<<

Universal Groove Free Party
Saturday April 5th, 2003

Universal Groovers ~
Reckless Ryan (KSJS 90.5, Straight Hits, UG)
DJ Elz
Kyle Something
Spective
Wavelength
Cooraw
Epsilon

- Located in the South Bay
- 18 and up
- Dress Code: No sports attire, no tennis shoes, dress to impress

To attend for free, you must send your name as well as the names of the
guests in your party, to UGPRODUCTIONS@AOL.COM by 8am PST on Saturday
April 5th. After that, guestlist is closed! Be there before 11:00.

http://hometown.aol.com/ugproductions/myhomepage/profile.html

We hope to see you there!

Ian Jackson
Universal Groove

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr :: why would you name a movie *holes*

Holes are interesting things. Some people see a hole and are just 
content to let it be a hole. Others see a hole and decide right away 
that a hole just isn't very useful unless you put something in it. Of 
course, then it's not really a hole any more.

BS

!! WAKEY.WAKEY !!

Well it seems like this is a monthly occurance where Tyler and I throw a =
houseparty so we're continuing that tradition in celebration of =
Marshal's birthday. For those of you who aren't sure who Marshal is =
that's your fearless leader of SWAT.Sound and the generous guy who lets =
us use part of his sound system in our house. As usual it's open decks =
so dj's bring your records. Rumors of a keg being provided are leaking =
out, but bring your team lush supplies like any good Lush.Scout should! =
We now have a mini studio setup next to the decks and are able to =
broadcast/record sets. We're busting out sound curtains (thank you Mike =
and Erik) so as to not piss off the neighbors again. The red light will =
be on which means debauchery will ensue. What else would you expect from =
one of our house parties?? We might just setup a 2x4 again for the =
battle.royale action where 2 dj's enter and only one leaves.

The flogging will begin at 9pm Pacific Raver Time

:: di.rections ::

send email to aeclubsyou@hotmail.com for spelled out directions.=20

MapQuest licks.balls

ryan.bailey
sninesix.design

photography :: www.innocentchild.com

any of them friendly though? does it make them more sexy..maybe they
used to be a GREAT PROMOTION...i think they still are.  :)

From sfraves-return-100775-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Fri Apr 04 00:30:50 2003

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Patriot II

--=====================_5320353==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Get Ready for PATRIOT II

By Matt Welch, AlterNet
April 2, 2003

The "fog of war" obscures more than just news from the battlefield. It also=
=20
provides cover for radical domestic legislation, especially ill-considered=
=20
liberty-for-security swaps, which have been historically popular at the=20
onset of major conflicts.

The last time allied bombs fell over a foreign capital, the Bush=20
Administration rammed through the USA PATRIOT Act, a clever acronym for=20
maximum with-us-or-against-us leverage (the full name is "Uniting and=20
Strengthening America by Providing Appropriate Tools Required to Intercept=
=20
and Obstruct Terrorism").

Remarkably, this 342-page law was written, passed (by a 98-1 vote in the=20
U.S. Senate) and signed into law within seven weeks of the Sept. 11=20
terrorist attack. As a result, the government gained new power to wiretap=20
phones, confiscate property of suspected terrorists, spy on its own=20
citizens without judicial review, conduct secret searches, snoop on the=20
reading habits of library users, and so General John Ashcroft wants to=20
finish the job. On Jan. 10, 2003, he sent around a draft of PATRIOT II;=20
this time, called "The Domestic Security Enhancement Act of 2003." The more=
=20
than 100 new provisions, Justice Department spokesperson Mark Corallo told=
=20
the Village Voice recently, "will be filling in the holes" of PATRIOT I,=20
"refining things that will enable us to do our job."

Though Ashcroft and his mouthpieces have issued repeated denials that the=20
draft represents anything like a finished proposal, the Voice reported=20
that: "Corallo confirmed ... that such measures were coming soon."

You can read the entire 87-page draft here. Constitutional watchdog Nat=20
Hentoff has called it "the most radical government plan in our history to=20
remove from Americans their liberties under the Bill of Rights." Some of=20
DSEA's more draconian provisions:

Americans could have their citizenship revoked, if found to have=20
contributed "material support" to organizations deemed by the government,=20
even retroactively, to be "terrorist." As Hentoff wrote in the Feb. 28=20
Village Voice: "Until now, in our law, an American could only lose his or=20
her citizenship by declaring a clear intent to abandon it. But =96 and read=
=20
this carefully from the new bill =96 'the intent to relinquish nationality=
=20
need not be manifested in words, but can be inferred from conduct.'"=20
(Italics Hentoff's.)

Legal permanent residents (like, say, my French wife), could be deported=20
instantaneously, without a criminal charge or even evidence, if the=20
Attorney General considers them a threat to national security. If they=20
commit minor, non-terrorist offenses, they can still be booted out, without=
=20
so much as a day in court, because the law would exempt habeas corpus=20
review in some cases. As the American Civil Liberties Union stated in its=20
long brief against the DSEA, "Congress has not exempted any person from=20
habeas corpus =96 a protection guaranteed by the Constitution =96 since the=
=20
Civil War."

The government would be instructed to build a mammoth database of citizen=20
DNA information, aimed at "detecting, investigating, prosecuting,=20
preventing or responding to terrorist activities." Samples could be=20
collected without a court order; one need only be suspected of wrongdoing=20
by a law enforcement officer. Those refusing the cheek-swab could be fined=
=20
$200,000 and jailed for a year. "Because no federal genetic privacy law=20
regulates DNA databases, privacy advocates fear that the data they contain=
=20
could be misused," Wired News reported March 31. "People with 'flawed' DNA=
=20
have already suffered genetic discrimination at the hands of employers,=20
insurance companies and the government."

Authorities could wiretap anybody for 15 days, and snoop on anyone's=20
Internet usage (including chat and email), all without obtaining a warrant.

The government would be specifically instructed not to release any=20
information about detainees held on suspicion of terrorist activities,=20
until they are actually charged with a crime. Or, as Hentoff put it, "for=20
the first time in U.S. history, secret arrests will be specifically=20
permitted."

Businesses that rat on their customers to the Feds =96 even if the=20
information violates privacy agreements, or is, in fact, dead wrong =96=
 would=20
be granted immunity. "Such immunity," the ACLU contended, "could provide an=
=20
incentive for neighbor to spy on neighbor and pose problems similar to=20
those inherent in Attorney General Ashcroft's Operation TIPS."

Police officers carrying out illegal searches would also be granted legal=20
immunity if they were just carrying out orders.

Federal "consent decrees" limiting local law enforcement agencies'=20
abilities to spy on citizens in their jurisdiction would be rolled back. As=
=20
Howard Simon, executive director of Florida's ACLU, noted in a March 19=20
column in the Sarasota Herald Tribune: "The restrictions on political=20
surveillance were hard-fought victories for civil liberties during the=
 1970s."

American citizens could be subject to secret surveillance by their own=20
government on behalf of foreign countries, including dictatorships.

The death penalty would be expanded to cover 15 new offenses.

And many of PATRIOT I's "sunset provisions" =96 stipulating that the=
 expanded=20
new enforcement powers would be rescinded in 2005 =96 would be erased from=
=20
the books, cementing Ashcroft's rushed legislation in the law books. As UPI=
=20
noted March 10, "These sunset provisions were a concession to critics of=20
the bill in Congress."

I wouldn't be writing this article today had an alarmed Justice Department=
=20
staffer not leaked the draft to the Center for Public Integrity in early=20
February. Ashcroft, up to that point, had repeatedly refused to even=20
discuss what his lawyers might be cooking up. But if 10,000 residents of=20
Los Angeles had been vaporized by a "suitcase nuke" in late January, it is=
=20
reasonable to assume that the then-secret proposal would have been=20
speed-delivered for a congressional vote, even though Congress has not so=20
far participated in drafting the legislation (which is, after all, its=20
Constitutional role).

As a result of the leak, and the ensuing bad press, opposition to the=20
measure has had time to gather momentum before the first bomb was dropped=20
on Saddam's bunker. Some of the criticism has originated from the right=20
side of the political spectrum =96 a March 17 open letter to Congress was=20
signed not only by the ACLU and People for the American Way, but the=20
cultural-conservative think tank Free Congress Foundation, the Gun Owners=20
of America, the American Conservative Union, and more.

One does not have to believe that Ashcroft is a Constitution-shredding=20
ghoul to find these measures alarming, improper and possibly illegal.=20
Glancing over the list above, and at the other DSEA literature, I can see=20
multiple ways in which a Fed with a grudge could legally ruin my life.=20
Removing checks and balances on law enforcement assumes perfect behavior on=
=20
the part of the police.

Safeguarding civil liberties is an unpopular project in the most placid of=
=20
times. Since Sept. 11, the Bush Administration has shown that it will push=
=20
the envelope on nearly every restriction it considers to be impeding its=20
prosecution of the war on terrorism. This single-minded drive requires=20
extreme vigilance, before the fog of war becomes toxic.

Detailed critiques of the Patriot II draft have been prepared by the ACLU=20
and the Center for Public Integrity. The Lawyers Committee for Human Rights=
=20
also has a useful 98-page report on post-Sept. 11 civil liberties, and the=
=20
Electronic Privacy Information Center maintains an outstanding=20
PATRIOT-related site.

Matt Welch is the Los Angeles correspondent for the National Post, and an=20
editor of the L.A. Examiner. He also maintains a weblog about current=
 events.

http://www.alternet.org/story.html?StoryID=3D15541




Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is=
=20
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"The West won the world not by the superiority of its ideas or values or=20
religion but rather by its superiority in applying organized violence.=20
Westerners often forget this fact, non-Westerners never do."
-Samuel P. Huntington

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the President or that we=20
are to stand by the President right or wrong is not only unpatriotic and=20
servile but it is morally treasonable to the American public."
-Theodore Roosevelt, 1918

--=====================_5320353==_.ALT--

black)..

maybe Kirkwood if there is no chain restrictions.

for another 10-16" tonight/early morning. Temps are around 15-25 
degrees.. so it should be nice and dry.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: The BrainTree, tonight @ 1015

The BrainTree, Creative Convergence, Thursday April 3,2003

@1015Folsom.VisualArt/Sound/Performance 830pm-230am



Featuring Music by:

Gavin Harkiss aka HAWKE(sixdegrees/sunburn records) .

The Diamond Galaxy(live breaks band/thediamondgalaxy.com)

DJ Polywog(djpolywog.org)

Isola(live organic/ 9 piece band)

DJ Label, House Of Lotus, Joel Wyborny,

Evan Madden vs Mike Frugalletti(beattherapysf.com)

Justincredible & The Dirty Little Bitches



Visual Art by:

Kat Zuidema(Amsterdam)  Sam Flores(samflores.com) Point(one point.cz)

Ryan Stubbs, Justin Young(justinyoungart.com) DigitalDan(dandoerner.com)

Seth Maxwell(malice) Natasha Troussova(natashadesign.com)

Christopher Fisher, Christopher Jernberg, ThwenChaloemtiarana,

Dierdre Defranceaux, Max Dijksterhuis(Amsterdam/max33.com)



Perfomance: Viscious Swan Lake, and always special guestsand interactive
art.



Free before 9, $5-10 sliding scale,



This is the second installment of the BrainTree, an evolving event that
invites creative participation and experimentation,converging the best
local and international artists of all genres every first Thursday.



Next Month: MAY 1st (Flower Day) Organic Peace www.thebraintree.org

Friday, April 4th 2003

Tribal Souls Presents:

Djs:
The First West Coast appearance of:

Patrick Turner (Movim, Bluem, Nightshift, Low Pressings/ Baltimore,MD),
Shawn (Houseplant, Marinate/SF),
Trushil (Groove),
Kelly Williams (Tribal Souls),
Phil Gauthier (Tribal Souls),
Jesse (Tribal Souls),
Stevo (Tribal Souls)

Come see this top new dj/producer Patrick Turner for the very first time on 
the West coast straight out of Baltimore. He is only 22 years young and has 
released more than 22 tracks on over 6 different labels across the globe, and 
producing tracks with the likes of Jay Tripwire, such as the one that the duo 
just released called "Altered States" on Movim records. For more info on 
Patrick go to  MOVIM Records.

10pm-6am,
18 and up,
Bay area underground location,
$15 all night
415.220.FUNK / 916.556.FUNK / 209.557.FUNK

This will be the 6th consecutive month for Tribal Souls at this location

From: Karina <karina@hyperreal.org>

SFRaves<-_->http: //www.sfraves.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Updates & Version 1.0 Teaser

Dear SFRaves,

The SFR Calendar interface is currently moving from the Beta phase
to Version 1.0 for the first release. This Important milestone is the
first release of the redesign SFR Calendar interface.

Please note:

Event Promoters, Promotions Groups, Venues, DJS -
please populate the database and add your events/promotions.

SFR Community: Please create an account and use the system if you haven't
done so. You can add yourself to a group, create your own profile and
group profile, create performance connections, link to your domains and
online projects, participate in polls and other voting apps, make your
name in the SFRaves community, check out other folks in the community, and
make performance connections between people, venues and groups.
Please create your account.

If you haven't already created an account, go here:
* Registration Form:

* Check out the redesign SFRaves.org Interface @
http://www.hyperreal.org:8080/raves/sf

-- THIS URL will be updated from the shift from beta to Version 1.0

* Read the SFR Calendar FAQ to get started @
http://www.sfraves.org/calendar/sfrcalfaq.txt.

* Submit Bugs for the New Calendar using the SF Raves Defect Database.
@ http://www2.sf-raves.net/

Please NOTE: URLS subject to change with further notice coming:

* Events: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events
* Groups: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/groups
* People: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/people
* Calendar:
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/view_calendar?mode-calendar=day
* Polls: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/polls/

The current calendar data is being populated, migrated and integrated as
part the current test phase of Beta to Version 1.0.

The SFR Rave Interface is currently in the final stages of the test
process in order to conduct a thorough and complete QA check, as well as
conduct a smooth transition from Beta to its first release. This process
entails testing all aspects of the application interface and certifying
that all functional and other changes made have been certified as ready
for release per QA standards applied.

This test phase will be complete by Sunday (of this week).  Be on the
lookout for an announcement marking this milestone.

The URLS pertaining to each section of the interface will be migrating to
a new format, this information will be provided as transformation is
complete. Older urls used as part of the Beta Testing phase will most
likely redirect to new URLS as well.

The 1.0 Version release is finally here!

Thanks for your support and participation to enhance the SFR calendar
interface..With your assistance, this project is a success. More details
regarding the 1.0 Launch coming soon!

Please note that I am moderating the calendar application, but all data
entered is the responsibility of the event promotions or collective group
/ dj. I am available for any questions relating to the interface. Please
contact me @ karina@hyperreal.org if you need any assistance.

Yours,

Karina

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Updates & Version 1.0 Teaser


Dear Greg/XS -

If you can't recall using it, I would encourage you to check it out.

Are you not using it because of these or other reasons -

Getting your information from other sources?
Do you go to events which may not be listed on the calendar?
(Undergrounds, house parties?)
...Your reason?

Response:

The calendar event data will be fully re-populated by this weekend. The
calendar will have up to date and current information and then some.
Hopefully it will serve you a purpose in the future, with 493 people and
170 groups, the new interface/calendar data and event information are
definately being used.

I would encourage you to use it, perhaps then you will find the
information you are looking for. If you can't recall using it, then you
might want to try it :)

PS  - Everything is what you make of it, if you don't use it, how can it
provide you with information your are looking for?

- Karina

> > make performance connections between people, venues and groups.
> > Please create your account.
> >
> > If you haven't already created an account, go here:
> > * Registration Form:
> >
> > * Check out the redesign SFRaves.org Interface @
> > http://www.hyperreal.org:8080/raves/sf
> >
> > -- THIS URL will be updated from the shift from beta to Version 1.0
> >
> > * Read the SFR Calendar FAQ to get started @
> > http://www.sfraves.org/calendar/sfrcalfaq.txt.
> >
> > * Submit Bugs for the New Calendar using the SF Raves Defect Database.
> > @ http://www2.sf-raves.net/
> >
> > Please NOTE: URLS subject to change with further notice coming:
> >
> > * Events: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events
> > * Groups: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/groups
> > * People: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/people
> > * Calendar:
> > http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/view_calendar?mode-calendar=day
> > * Polls: http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/polls/
> >
> > The current calendar data is being populated, migrated and integrated as
> > part the current test phase of Beta to Version 1.0.
> >
> > The SFR Rave Interface is currently in the final stages of the test
> > process in order to conduct a thorough and complete QA check, as well as
> > conduct a smooth transition from Beta to its first release. This process
> > entails testing all aspects of the application interface and certifying
> > that all functional and other changes made have been certified as ready
> > for release per QA standards applied.
> >
> > This test phase will be complete by Sunday (of this week).  Be on the
> > lookout for an announcement marking this milestone.
> >
> > The URLS pertaining to each section of the interface will be migrating to
> > a new format, this information will be provided as transformation is
> > complete. Older urls used as part of the Beta Testing phase will most
> > likely redirect to new URLS as well.
> >
> > The 1.0 Version release is finally here!
> >
> > Thanks for your support and participation to enhance the SFR calendar
> > interface..With your assistance, this project is a success. More details
> > regarding the 1.0 Launch coming soon!
> >
> > Please note that I am moderating the calendar application, but all data
> > entered is the responsibility of the event promotions or collective group
> > / dj. I am available for any questions relating to the interface. Please
> > contact me @ karina@hyperreal.org if you need any assistance.
> >
> > Yours,
> >
> > Karina

month ago or so... There aren't enough techno events around here..

currently and do not plan to in the near future --> studio bound...

Don't loose the trust...

Subject: [sfraves] RE: Get Ready for PATRIOT II

Folks:

As always, a big thanks to Apollo for bringing the proposed Patriot Act 
II to our attention. Frightful in its scope, a primary source for both 
the first Patriot Act and the proposed Patriot Act II is the extremist 
doctrine called "Project for a New American Century". Created by 
William Kristol and Robert Kagan in 1997, this belief system was 
reportedly ignored by GeeDubya (CEO of ShrubCo), but has since been 
fully embraced by the federal administration, including GeeDubya.

Basically, the Project for a New American Century 
(http://www.newamericancentury.org/) states that since the USA is the 
world's only superpower, that we have the right and the might to shape 
the world the way we want to our own ends. This belief system is the 
engine behind our current invasion of Iraq and planned invasions of 
other countries.

Please consider reviewing the website and sharing with your friends 
this horrific neo-fascist doctrine masquerading as conservativism. 
Nothing less than the battle for our remaining Constitutional rights 
and liberties is at hand.

Thanks  & peace.

James Lovette-Black (Jim)

Thanks Dominic, I am great. Hope you are so well.
=A0
Yes, I know a fact that .DJ domain registration fee is more higher than othe=
r=20
TLDs=A0such as=A0.com and=A0.net.
For that reason, I would like to explain about Top-level domain's=A0backgrou=
nd=20
so that you can understand why the domain price has to be this like.
=A0
Generally, there are two types of Top-level domain names. One is called=20
General Top-level domain (TLDs)=A0as known as .COM, .NET and=A0.INFO, and=
=A0its=20
registration services have been performed by some commercial companies and=20
most easy-remember names have been taken already. That's why these common=20
domain names are currently served at lower price, as compared to=20
other=A0Country Code Top-level domains (ccTLDs) such as .TV, .CC, .UK and=20
.DE.=A0The ccTLDs are two-letter TLDs that correspond to a country, territor=
y,=20
or other geographic location. The rules and policies for registering domain=20
name in the ccTLDs vary significantly and some are reserved for use by=20
citizens of the corresponding country(closed ccTLD, such as .US, .UK, .JP)=20
and the others are unrestricted for use by all users around the world (open=20
ccTLDs, such as .TV, .CC, .DJ). A .DJ domain is a ccTLD and the ISO-3166=20
two-letter TLDs for Republic of Djibouti and is opened for anyone who desire=
s=20
to have a domain name for any purposes and its registration services have=20
been performed by dotDJ Corporation, the SOLE authorized registrar offering=20
.dj domain registration services on behalf of Republic of Djibouti since=20
Dec.2001.=A0
=A0
Therefore, due to some=A0reasons=A0agreed=A0with Djibouti, we=A0are currentl=
y=20
offering the .DJ domain names at $50 per year, as similar as other ccTLDs an=
d=20
the .DJ domain name will go on to offer at the same price. If=A0any=20
clients=A0wish to get a .DJ domain name at a discounted price, our multi-yea=
rs=20
registration services will give more benefits to them in order to secure=A0t=
he=20
domain name with longer period at the bigger discount. Regarding a range of=20
different prices among .DJ domain names, we currently have two product - One=
=20
is called General Domain registered at $50 per year and the other is called=20
Premium Domain that=A0the initial=A0registration fees each premium domain na=
me=20
vary=A0with the duration of 1 year.=A0Premium domains=A0contain some generic=
=20
keywords and one-, two-, three-, characters,=A0which are in=A0either English=
=20
alphabet or numeric characters.=A0
=A0
Do you know that=A0a domain name is one of online properties and it is=20
essential in order to acquire positive results and its worth cannot be=20
valued. In addition, the .dj is perfect name for individuals and companies i=
n=20
the music industry and is the easiest way to be found online by both fans an=
d=20
business contacts. as any aliases routed to the website cannot be=20
representative of what sort of business you are in. So we are so pleased to=20
offer this registration services for all DJ's around the world.
=A0
Hope it helps.

If you have more questions, just to email me at any time :)

*************GIRLS JUST WANNA HAVE FUN UPDATE***************

Ok kids!!!  Due to strong support for this event, from all over California,
including the SF bay area, as well as LA and SAC (as well as the fact that
our original venue is having legal difficulties) we have now secured a more
conveniently located venue.  This event will now be starting at 8 PM sharp
and going strong till 4 AM.  There will no longer be a bar for the 21+, but
we will be passing the 2AM bar curfew. There will friendly security (B&B
Security) and staff, as well as many free CD giveaways.  Presales tickets
are still available at Skills, Solid Grooves, and F8 for $10.  We will also
have door tickets available for $12 the night of the event.  Hope to see you
all there, AND PLEASE RESPECT THIS VENUE, it is a GREAT asset to the scene!

Time slots will be posted later this week and call the infoline the day of
the event for directions.

Hardcore For The People and Gurlycore Productions has brought together an
all female lineup so that the ladies of hardcore can showcase their skills,
rock the crowd and prove the girls can do it just as good as the boys!!!

Girls Just Wanna Have Fun!!!
Friday, April 4th 2003
All Ages/All Hardcore!
Limited capacity!

Mime-Version: 1.0
X-Sender: blindspot@mail.mac.com
Message-Id: <p04330102bab38681f1fd@[172.16.2.25]>
In-Reply-To: <A2818A00-66C2-11D7-B90B-0003937F1646@yahoo.com>
References: <A2818A00-66C2-11D7-B90B-0003937F1646@yahoo.com>
Date: Fri, 4 Apr 2003 11:14:37 -0800
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: blindspot <blindspot@mac.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii" ; format="flowed"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] RE: Get Ready for PATRIOT II

I am not naive. But what concerns me most about all of this PATRIOT 
act stuff is the lack of faith between citizens and government. It 
seems that we should seek the ideal of a solid and faithful 
relationship between citizens who are not a part of the government 
and citizens who ARE part of the government. There should be open 
lines of communication. We should be treating each other like 
thinking, feeling human beings and not like faceless masses set 
against each other.

I am not a terrorist. I wish no harm on the US government and/or the 
people who make up that government. As a citizen, I like to think 
about problems that perplex our society and how we can come up with 
real solutions in our government to solve those problems. Part of 
this problem solving process is pointing out flaws in the system. 
There are many. Not all of them can be addressed at once. It is my 
right and duty to criticize the government and those who run it. 
Though I do not take pleasure in finding those flaws, I DO take 
pleasure in seeking them out because it his how we become better.

It is my hope that undertakings like the Patriot Act I and II are not 
implemented out of "bad faith" by the government. It is also my hope 
that citizens do not have "bad faith" when dealing with their 
government. Though recent events have probably given them plenty of 
reason to feel so.

I do not wish to live in fear of my government. I wish to have 
dialogue and to openly criticize when things are not right. I do not 
expect to be persecuted for it. Which is why one must speak openly, 
clearly, and always on the record about all things political in 
nature. There can be no room for misunderstandings or misperceptions 
of intention. These are dangerous times. If you hide in the shadows 
beware of bullets shot into darkness.

BS

>since been fully embraced by the federal administration, including 
>GeeDubya.

>(http://www.newamericancentury.org/) states that since the USA is 
>the world's only superpower, that we have the right and the might to 
>shape the world the way we want to our own ends. This belief system 
>is the engine behind our current invasion of Iraq and planned 
>invasions of other countries.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Updates & Version 1.0 Teaser

i dont intend to be any "expert" on the scene (and in fact probably know
very little), but i am not aware of a party that has been shutdown lately
due to it being advertised on the net.  i might even go out on a limb and
say it seems that somewhat of a medium has been reached between promoters
and law enforcement (although ive heard rumors that crackdowns may be coming
again) where events are either being held in legal or quasi-legal locations
or they are being organized well enough as to not draw any unnecessary
attention.

if there are really enough of you that are so disenchanted with the current
happenings in the scene, maybe some of you should take the current
opportunities to organize events more to your liking.  or, if advertising of
these "worthwhile" parties is really such a big problem, perhaps someone
needs to invent a new method by which people are made known of such
happenings.

chris
http://www.norcalraves.org

From: Mike Migurski [mailto:mike@saturn5.com]

>Perhaps Mike should have clarified. There is nothing going on worth his
>time to go out for. Unless you're into the foofoo side of partying there
>isn't much. The parties that do happen that are worth going to can't be
>posted to that calendar. That's why the sfr calendar died. Police used it
>as a checklist to bust parties a while back.

Yes I should have clarified - It wasn't just cops using it to bust parties
either. There were well-supported rumors of less-than-scrupulous promoters
using the calendar to screw the competition. In any case, I feel that
(with some notable, yet rare, exceptions) the worthwhile parties don't get
posted to the calendar.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Updates & Version 1.0 Teaser

We do organize our own events and keep them off major lists. The last few
years of this list have proven that SFR isn't safe. Maybe that's changed
now, but I look at the past and take that into strong consideration in event
promotion. There's a lot that happens that does ever see the light of day on
sfraves. Special parties with good music aren't as prominant and when they
happen they don't get blasted to the masses for good reasons. Sounds
elitist, but it's just a safety net to ensure the success of the party.

ryan.bailey
sninesix.design

photography :: www.innocentchild.com

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: !BSP!   TRUST / MINDCONTROL   05172003 

this is not my party but it sounds like an incredibly
high-production event.  call up JK sound and ask them
how much it costs to rent a 40-foot-wide wall of sound
for a night.  sound and lights are bloody expensive
and involve a lot of labor.  if you bring a performer
from overseas you might be looking at a $400 flight,
couple nights in a $200 4-star hotel, meals, etc. 
that's on top of their rate, which might be as much as
a couple grand.  that is money that can no longer go
toward sound & lighting, security, decoration, food &
water - the things that really make the party feel
special.  more often than not i find that a $20+
entrance at an underground indicates that the
promoters are busting their ass to throw a great
party.  not always, but a little experience will show
you who is doing events for profit.  i know a few of
the ppl involved with this particular party and for
what my opinion is worth, they're definitely not in it
for the money.
peace
dave | dj m

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: !BSP!   TRUST / MINDCONTROL   05172003 


hey Philip

Spending money, like most things, is an issue of priorities.

Trust has always been about putting together insane full-blown
productions, and high-level design/planning/execution.  Also, like FnF the
crew does not get paid.  In fact, we're paying the exact same amount as
everyone else, and we're working!  There is no guest list.   Also, trust
does not profit off its events.   This is no corperation set out to
gouge the scene.  This is a community service for the good of all people.

What makes it worth it to us?  To do all this work, then pay on top of it,
to see it go off...

We do not cater to the masses.  We have a strong following of very
dedicated people that know the level of quality that we deliver every
time we put an event together.  They know the value of what we provide,
and will promote it to their friends.   That is all we need.  We do it for
ourselves.

What makes it worth $20?

Maybe the fact that we print on recycled papers, using not only eco-safe
flyers, but flyers that will actually decompose within 500 years, unlike
the high gloss cheap flyers that are industry standard nowdays.

What makes it worth $20?

Maybe it's the twin walls of sound...  Something very very rare in this
area.

What makes it worth $20?

Come and find out!




See you there!

-e-

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] SFR Calendar Updates & Version 1.0 Teaser

>i dont intend to be any "expert" on the scene (and in fact probably know
>very little), but i am not aware of a party that has been shutdown lately
>due to it being advertised on the net.

I don't think it's happened for a long time. It was enough of a problem a
few years back to make a lot of people permanently wary of the SFR
Calendar. The end result was that a lot of UG parties simply stopped
getting posted to SFR, except as a last-minute tip of the hat. I still
believe that the calendar is useful for events such as Trust or Infinite
Beat, which are underground in one sense, but have a budget, are tacitly
legit and need a critical-mass crowd to truly go off the way they're
intended. Anyway, I guess my badly-worded, untactful original point was
that the SFR calendar is no longer the focus of SF's energy through no
fault of its own.


>if advertising of these "worthwhile" parties is really such a big
>problem, perhaps someone needs to invent a new method by which people are
>made known of such happenings.

"Word of Mouth Only" - the oldest and most effective method in the world.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: !BSP!   TRUST / MINDCONTROL   05172003 


Hey Mike

Thanks for the note!

I agree with you that bringing in special people is important, and
we do make every effort to do so.  We are just more picky about people
above and beyond just their music.

Our main experience with hiring out of state "superstar" djs is that it's
just not worth it.  We've had our share of them believe me, and nearly
every time it goes against the vibe of the rest of the event.  Sometimes it
just gets ugly, and they scare people.  =P

If there's an amazing act out there who is also a great person, they
would match what we are after here.  Just some freak who makes good
techno?  Probably not the best candidate for a trust event.

Cheers!

-e-

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
